basics.name: Yaqian Chen
basics.label: Ph.D. Student in Electrical and Computer Engineering
basics.summary: Ph.D. student at Duke University focusing on deep learning for medical image analysis, including medical image segmentation and registration, foundation models, and clinically relevant AI methodologies.

work.name: Duke University - Mazurowski Lab, Duke AI Health Spark Initiative
work.summary: Researching medical image segmentation and registration, foundation models, self-supervised learning, and clinical AI applications.
highlights: Developed registration networks for breast MRI FGT registration, outperforming existing models by over 13.01%.
Established benchmarks for foundation model-based registration (MICCAI workshop best paper award).
Developed automatic CT abdominal muscle and fat segmentation for body composition analysis.
Extended breast segmentation methods for breast density estimation on breast MRI.
Conducted rapid, large-scale evaluation of SAM2 across 21 diverse medical imaging datasets.

work.name: The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen - AIRS
work.summary: Worked on simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) and robotics applications.
highlights: Proposed monocular semantic SLAM system for outdoor UAV applications.

work.name: UBTECH
work.summary: Prepared and delivered 14 lectures on ML algorithms and robotics applications.

education.institution: The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen

awards.title: Best Paper Award - MICCAI Workshop
awards.summary: Awarded for 'Are Vision Foundation Models Ready for Out-of-the-Box Medical Image Registration?'

awards.title: Dean's List of the School of Science and Engineering
awards.awarder: The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen
awards.summary: Top 20% of undergraduates in the School of Science and Engineering.

awards.awarder: The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen
awards.summary: Top 30 out of 448 undergraduates in the School of Science and Engineering.
